creator: post383

content:
Check there are no hidden threads or ignored threads

  • View > Folders > All
  • View > Threads > All

Check folder does not have a filter operating. Eg: Quick Filter Bar Do you see any icon highlighted on the Quick Filter Bar like 'show only unread messages' ? or even the 'pin' icon which may be showing a previously selected filter setting ? if yes: Click on highlighted icon to deselect the filter.

You mention Imap Imap can only display whatever is on the server. So it might be helpful to know what is on the server ? Logon to the webmail account via a browser and check the Inbox on the server.

Do you have any other device accessing the server to view emails eg: another computer or phone ?

content:
Hello Matt, Thanks for responding to my query.

To answer your specific question, I am still receiving emails and can also send emails. The problem is that because Thunderbird can't see the Sent folder I have to log in to Gmail through my browser to check that the email has been sent.

I am beginning to suspect that the problem is with the Gmail SMTP server. I think my credentials have somehow been corrupted. I tried restoring my laptop from a 1st March image backup because I knew everything was okay then and Thunderbird could see the Sent folder. But after the restore, Thunderbird still couldn't see the Sent folder.

I tried creating a new Gmail account and Thunderbird has no problems with this account and can see the Sent folder.

I also tried removing and re-adding the old account, but Thunderbird just re-added the account using the old account data so that didn't achieve anything.

As a temporary work around I have set Thunderbird to copy sent messages from the old account to the new account. That works and allows me to manage everything on the laptop again.

content: Perhaps you would be kind to say what you did to fix this problem, then if anyone else has the same issue they can use your helpful information.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
You will probably not be surprised if I said you are doing this yourself. I'll explain how you are doing it and why it is occuring. I'll also offer further information on other choices.

If that folder has been set up to use 'threading' you will see it mentioned in this location.

  • Select folder you want to check.
  • 'View' > 'Sort by'

If 'threaded' is selected then any emails that are linked by the subject eg: repeated replies back and forth as in a conversation, will have a 'threaded' setting.

The intial email of the thread will be displayed. To the left of the Subject will be a right pointing chevron > meaning that thread is in a collapsed state. So it is not just one email, it's a group. If you double click on that threaded email group whilst in a collapsed state then it will open the selected email and all of it's threaded emails - the entire group; each in a separate tab. You have selected to open the entire group - not a single email. This is by design and has been like this for eons. It is not a fault nor a bug. It's a function to facilate opening a group of threaded emails.

You would need to 'expand' the thread by clicking on the > chevron so it displays all the various conversation threads contains therein. Then you can click on them individually, you are then opening only the one you selected.

If you do not want the emails to be threaded and shown as a group then you need to change the settings:

  • 'View' > 'Sort by' > select 'unthreaded'

If you use 'unthreaded' but you want to see that particular email conversation as a group then you can always choose the following:

  • Right click on email and select 'Open Message in Conversation'

This will open in a tab, showing all the received and sent emails for that conversation in one search style tab.

Hope this information is useful and helps you make informed choices.
creator: Toad-Hall

creator: EastTenn

content: V102 changed the default from unthreaded to threaded.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
The developers decided to make it a default. No idea why. It's caused much annoyance to some and total confusion to those who never used it before.

I've added an image below which visually shows how to set the 'Sort by' unthreaded' via two method. If you are accustomed to using the top Menu Bar it is under 'View' > 'Sort by' If you are accustomed to using the 'menu app icon' - it has 3 horizontal lines, you need to click on the 'menu app icon' first to see drop down option where you select 'View', then 'Sort by' and finally you can select 'Unthreaded'.

Is the image too small ? In this forum question - if you click on the thumbnail image it appears a lot bigger.


If you do not want any new folders you create to get that auto threaded setting then change the following: Note: 'Settings' can be found in several places. Bottom of 'Spaces Toobar' - click on wheel cog icon Via top Menu Bar - 'Tools' > 'Settings' Via menu app icon - select 'Settings;

  • Settings > General
  • Scroll to the bottom
  • click on 'Config Editor' button
  • In top search type: flags
  • look for this line: mailnews.default_view_flags

It will have a value of 1 (one)

  • Click on the far right icon pencil icon to allow edit
  • Completely remove the value 1 and enter the value to 0 (zero)
  • The pencil icon is now a tick icon - click on the tick icon to Save the setting.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Thank you, Matt for being the first to say this was not my fault. Thank you, Toad Hall for agreeing with that and giving specific directions to get rid of the annoyance.
